info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 18 at 8:48PM CDT until August 22 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...
Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County.
Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...
Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County.
Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Chippewa, Renville and Yellow Medicine Counties.
Minnesota River at Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties.
Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Chippewa, Lac qui Parle and Yellow Medicine Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm.
* WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to Friday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters begin to impact Cottonwood Street west of the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Monday, the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 12.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.4 feet on 06/01/2004.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY EVENING
